title: How much of free music can we use without a copyright on that song? - Quora

response.answer_text: You might have heard that you could use upto ten seconds of an audio track and not bother about copyright violation. But this is not true. Even using a second of a track can give you a copyright strike. It depends on the copyright owner though, they can chose to request a takedown, monetize your video or not bother altogether.

Original question: Can I use thirty seconds of a song in my indie movie free of charge? Only if you write and record the track yourself. There is no such thing as a 30-second exemption. If money is an issue, there are hundreds of music libraries out there that will licence tracks for you for reasonable amounts.
